Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF MIAMI SCHOOL OF MEDICINEEMORY UNIVERSITY

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: We are grateful to the CReATe (Clinical Research in ALS and Related Disorders for Therapeutic Development) Consortium for making these data available for public use. The CReATe Consortium is part of the Rare Diseases Clinical Research Network (RDCRN), which is funded by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and led by the National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences (NCATS) through its Office of Rare Diseases Research (ORDR). CReATe is funded through a collaboration between NCATS and National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS) (U54NS092091). CReATe is also supported by the RDCRN Data Management and Coordinating Center (DMCC) (U2CTR002818). The genomics sequencing was funded by St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital American Lebanese Syrian Associated Charities (ALSAC), with additional support from the ALS Association for biorepository and sequencing costs (grants 17-LGCA-331 and 16-TACL-242).

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.
